summary: An FBI 302 form documenting a call to the FBI National Threat Operations Center on July 2, 2020, from a woman reporting her 1999 interactions with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in Vancouver, Canada. The caller described being introduced to them, visiting their apartment, witnessing a massage, having her photo taken, and being questioned about younger friends.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FBI investigation for child sex trafficking. The caller reported interacting with him in 1999 in Vancouver.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Was with Jeffrey Epstein in Vancouver in 1999. Gave the caller a business card and asked if she had younger friends.

connections.description: Were together in an apartment in Vancouver in 1999, both interacting with the caller and asking about younger girls.

events.title: Interaction in Vancouver
events.description: The caller, then 23, was introduced to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell and visited their apartment in Vancouver, Canada. A massage took place, her photograph was taken by a professional photographer, and Maxwell asked if she had younger friends.

events.title: FBI NTOC Call
events.description: A woman called the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report her 1999 interactions with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: A woman reported a 1999 interaction with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in Vancouver, Canada.
During the visit to their apartment, a massage occurred and the caller's photograph was taken by a professional photographer.
Ghislaine Maxwell gave the caller a business card and asked if she had friends who were younger girls.
The caller was 23 years old at the time of the incident in 1999.
The report was made to the FBI National Threat Operations Center on July 2, 2020.
